com.scriptbasic.executors

Class MethodRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scriptbasic.executors.MethodRegistry

  • public class MethodRegistry
extends Object
    Keep a registry of methods. The Java methods (either class or object method) can be called from BASIC. The problem is that Java methods can be overloaded and BASIC functions can not. To overcome this issue the BASIC program has to declare a function name for each method it wants to call. For example: 
     method sin from java.lang.Math is (double) use as sinus
    Here the method sin is to be used from the java package java.lang.Math and the alias is sinus. The use as sinus part is optional. In that case the alias of the function is the original name of the function.

    If there are two methods of the same name, with different signature, you have to define different aliases for the different methods.

    Not that you can use the same alias for different methods in different packages.

    Also note that you can also use aliases for Class names.

    The registry keeps track of the name of the method, the alias, the class and the signature. Thus whenever there is a function call in BASIC to call a Java method in a certain class this registry will know which signature to use for the certain alias.

    Author:
    Peter Verhas

    • Method Detail

      • getJavaMethod

        public Method getJavaMethod(Class<?> klass,
                   String alias)
                     throws ExecutionException
        Get the method for a given alias used to name a method in a specific Java class.
        Parameters:
        klass - the class where the method is.
        alias - the alias with which the method was registered for a specific signature.
        Returns:
        the located method that match the name and the signature that was registered.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if the method can not be accessed, e.g. there is no such method or accessing the method violates java security

      • registerJavaMethod

        public void registerJavaMethod(String alias,
                      Class<?> klass,
                      String methodName,
                      Class<?>[] argumentTypes)
        Register a java method.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias of the method. This is the name how the BASIC program will refer to the method.
        klass - the class in which the method is implemented
        methodName - the Java name of the method
        argumentTypes - the argument classes that form the signature of the method together with the name of the method.
